channel.title: ssh anonymous connection
channel.description: Hi I'm connecting to my VPS from whonix to SSH. Every time i login to my server it says "Last login from ip address". These addresses are tor exit nodes ips. If someone look into logs they can see this metadata ip+timestamp of connection. Over time i be connecting thousand times to that server so there will be many ips+timestamps. With that information adversary can make correlations. If they control both entry and exit nodes, they can easily deanonymize me. How i can improve my anonymity when connection to ssh ? does setting up hidden service and connecting using .onion address instead of real server ip would help ?

item.title: ssh anonymous connection

item.title: ssh anonymous connection
item.dc:creator: zafe
item.description:
HulaHoop:

Any pseudonymous interaction runs a bigger risk with time, but it doesn;t automatically “break Tor” by itself.

What you mean mean by pseudonymous interactions ?

If i connect to ssh using .onion address does my server logs will be “connection from 127.0.0.1 …” I’m not worry about brutforce, i’m just trying to undestand if connecting to ssh using .onion minimize ip logs,metadata etc.
I red that is better not to leave tor network if possible - not cross exit nodes. So thats why i’m wondering if connecting to ssh using .onion rather than real server ip gives me anonymity points

Read full topic

item.title: ssh anonymous connection
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
zafe:

With that information adversary can make correlations.

Any pseudonymous interaction runs a bigger risk with time, but it doesn;t automatically “break Tor” by itself.

zafe:

If they control both entry and exit nodes, they can easily deanonymize me.

Not anymore as Tor adds defenses

zafe:

How i can improve my anonymity when connection to ssh ? does setting up hidden service and connecting using .onion address instead of real server ip would help ?

Hidden services are vulnerable to a different set of attacks so it’s all equal. You should use an Onion Service because they provide better protection against bruteforce attempts on your SSH server.

Read full topic

item.title: ssh anonymous connection
item.dc:creator: zafe
item.description:
Hi
I’m connecting to my VPS from whonix to SSH. Every time i login to my server it says “Last login from ip address”.
These addresses are tor exit nodes ips. If someone look into logs they can see this metadata ip+timestamp of connection. Over time i be connecting thousand times to that server so there will be many ips+timestamps. With that information adversary can make correlations. If they control both entry and exit nodes, they can easily deanonymize me.
How i can improve my anonymity when connection to ssh ? does setting up hidden service and connecting using .onion address instead of real server ip would help ?
